description: Primes p such that x^56 = 2 has no solution mod p, but x^28 = 2 has a solution mod p.
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..950
mathematica: Select[Prime[Range[PrimePi[10000]]], !MemberQ[PowerMod[Range[#], 56, #], Mod[2, #]] && MemberQ[PowerMod[Range[#], 28, #], Mod[2, #]]&] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 21 2013 *)
prog: (MAGMA) [p: p in PrimesUpTo(7000) | not exists{x: x in ResidueClassRing(p) | x^56 eq 2} and exists{x: x in ResidueClassRing(p) | x^28 eq 2}]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Sep 21 2012
author: _Klaus Brockhaus_, Feb 02 2001
